citations.narrative:
The large aviary housing peafowl and waterfowl does not have appropriate perching for the peafowl who are known to go
high and roost at night. There is an old scaffold in the enclosure that is used by the turkey but this is not species
appropriate and could cause potential harm. Perching that is species appropriate must be made available that is sufficient
in number, size, strength and texture to comfortable hold all the birds at the same time. This needs to be addressed for
the welfare of the birds.
Correct by: March 14, 2024

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have an environmental enhancement plan in place to promote the overall psychological well-being of
the birds at the facility. Exhibitors must develop, document and follow a species appropriate plan for the environmental
enhancement to promote the psychological well-being of the birds that is within industry standards and approved by the
attending veterinarian. This plan must be made available for future inspections.
Correct by: March 14, 2024

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Areas around the bird enclosures and directly in the large aviary are cluttered with items that do not promote good
housekeeping practices. In the large aviary, there is an old metal chair, old wire mesh enclosures and miscellaneous
stored items that need to be removed from the primary enclosure for the safety of the birds. Additionally, the area
between the raptors is filled with miscellaneous items (transport crates, broken shovel, buckets, wires, building materials,
etc). These areas need to be kept clean and in good repair to promote good housekeeping practices around the birds and
facility.
Correct by: Feb 28, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.153(a)(2) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The large aviary housing peafowl and waterfowl does not have appropriate perching for the peafowl who are known to go 
high and roost at night. There is an old scaffold in the enclosure that is used by the turkey but this is not species 
appropriate and could cause potential harm. Perching that is species appropriate must be made available that is sufficient 
in number, size, strength and texture to comfortable hold all the birds at the same time. This needs to be addressed for 
the welfare of the birds.  
Correct by: March 14, 2024 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility does not have an environmental enhancement plan in place to promote the overall psychological well-being of 
the birds at the facility. Exhibitors must develop, document and follow a species appropriate plan for the environmental 
enhancement to promote the psychological well-being of the birds that is within industry standards and approved by the 
attending veterinarian. This plan must be made available for future inspections.  
Correct by: March 14, 2024 
3.158(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Areas around the bird enclosures and directly in the large aviary are cluttered with items that do not promote good 
housekeeping practices. In the large aviary, there is an old metal chair, old wire mesh enclosures and miscellaneous 
stored items that need to be removed from the primary enclosure for the safety of the birds. Additionally, the area 
between the raptors is filled with miscellaneous items (transport crates, broken shovel, buckets, wires, building materials, 
etc). These areas need to be kept clean and in good repair to promote good housekeeping practices around the birds and 
facility.  
Correct by: Feb 28, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
